intro: Hibiscus affinis, commonly known as the sand hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or coastal soils, often found in wetlands and marshes. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Hibiscus affinis is known for its ability to thrive in humid, saline environments, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
